defs: = ಸರಸ್ವತಿ - 15.

(pros.) a metrical verse not having limitations on the number of lines, but each line usu.having six groups totalling to twenty syllabic units of varying combinations (from 3, 4, 5 and 6 units), and not restricted by alliteration rules.
a thin line connecting two points on the same plane, having no curvature or angularity; a straight line.

a man who is equal in rank, status, quality, capacity, etc. to another; ಸರಿಸಮಾನೆ sari samāne a woman who is equal in rank, status, quality, capacity, etc. to another; ಸರಿಯಾಗು sariyāgu to become equal to; to equal; 2. to become correct, appropriate; 3. to be free from errors, wrongs, etc.; ಸರಿಯಾಗಿ sariyāgi rightly; appropriately; in a proper manner; 2. in or to an equal extent or degree; uniformly, impartially, etc.; equally; 3. without mistake or mistakes; correctly; ಸರಿಮಾಡು sari māḍu to make something equal to (another); 2. to consider or treat something as equal to (another) 3. to correct; to make appropriate; 4. to bring (someone) to a right course (freeing from bad habits, wrong way of life, etc.); 5. to make level; to level; ಸರಿಗೇಱು sarigēṛu (fig.) to attack (something) to capture; 2. to rush or run toward; ಸಕ್ಕಟಸರಿ sakkaṭa sari = ಸರಿಸಮಾನ; ಸಕ್ಕಸರಿ sakka sari = ಸರಿಸಮಾನ; ಜೀನನ ಮನಸ್ಸು ಹೀನವೇಸರಿ jīnana manassu hīnavē sari (prov.) miserliness is nothing but meanness; ಸರಿಗೆ ಸಲ್ sarige sal = ಸರಿಯಾಗು - 1.
